content: different section below special note for this yarn i used the entire two skeins except for my swatch so be careful that your gauge is correct or you may run out of yarn when i made the wrap i knit the length as far as i could leaving just enough yarn to work the garter stitch edging and bind off except for yardage considerations row gauge is not particularly important pattern instructions cast on 62 stitches i used a long tail cast-on work 6 row in garter stitch knit every row then continue as follows rs row knit across ws row k3 p to last 3 sts k3 repeat these two row until you are about ½ short of the desired length ending with a rs row keep in mind that the size of the knitted piece will probably change after washing and blocking you may wish to stop a few inches short and take the time to put your work in progress on waste yarn and wet- block it before finishing this will give you the opportunity to fine-tune the length work 6 row in garter stitch and bind off i used a regular bind-off for the linen working it a bit loosely but i would recommend using a stretchier bind-off for other yarns or if your bind-off is too tight one suggestion would be the bind-off used for the silk/mohair version below wet-block the rectangle to about 14 x56 i blocked to 15 x54 but it relaxed to 14 x56 after it is dry scrunch and roll the fabric in your hands to soften it bend the rectangle into a u shape and seam the long edges together about 15 up from the short ends do not twist the fabric lay the rectangle flat and just slide the two short ends together to form the u i worked the seam by laying the wrap flat on a table right side up with the edges to be seamed next to each other i ran my needle and yarn through a garter bump on the edge of one side then the other side and pulled the yarn tight enough to close the gap between the two pieces but loose enough so that the seam was flat without creating a ridge on the wrong side weave in ends same thing only
